meditations.description: These are the simplest of mindfulness instructions. Enjoy the practice of mindfulness meditation.
meditations.title: Mindfulness Meditation

meditations.description: Want to open things up beyond the breath? Try focusing on the flow of experience as your primary object of meditation.
meditations.title: Open Awareness

meditations.description: Get out of your head and relax into your body! Here, you'll use your attention like a spotlight to direct your awareness from head to toe.
meditations.title: Body Scan

meditations.description: For when you want to fly solo.
meditations.title: Unguided (Timer)

meditations.description: You don't have to walk in slow motion for this meditation. Take a walk with Alexis on your way to work, from the bus, or just to get outside.
meditations.title: Walking

meditations.description: Technology and meditation do not need to be mutually exclusive. Try using your phone to mindfully explore the mind.
meditations.title: Using Your Phone

meditations.description: Transform the way you get from point A to point B in this session, turning the obstacle course into perfect terrain for meditation practice.
meditations.title: Commuting

meditations.description: Break the pattern of mindless eating by bringing attention to the process. You'll feel more satisfied with less.
meditations.title: Eating

meditations.description: Snap back from distracted driving and build awareness. This guided meditation can safely be done while you're on the road.
meditations.title: Driving

meditations.description: You don't have to contort your body for meditation to work. Let your hair down, kick back and meditate from the comfort of a relaxed pose.
meditations.title: Lying Down

meditations.description: Chronic stress can hurt your health and wellbeing. Try relaxing those hunched shoulders and pounding temples, coming back to equilibrium.
meditations.title: Stress

meditations.description: When we're walking around like a ticking time bomb, we run the risk of doing damage. Learn how to defuse anger in this meditation.
meditations.title: Anger

meditations.description: Practicing gratitude has been shown to increase your joy and resilience when life is taxing. It's a great way to uplift your day!
meditations.title: Gratitude

meditations.description: Self-criticism can skyrocket at even the slightest mistake. Give yourself a break from the onslaught of harsh self-talk in this meditation.
meditations.title: Self-Judgment

meditations.description: Anxiety can feel like a boa constrictor. Oren helps you loosen its grip, giving you space to breathe, relax and regain your footing.
meditations.title: Anxiety

meditations.description: Guilt can feel like an emotional weight on your shoulders. In this meditation, Oren helps you see the difference between guilt and remorse.
meditations.title: Guilt

meditations.description: Ready to explore the way sadness feels? This meditation will help you bring a patient, balanced attention to the experience.
meditations.title: Sadness

meditations.description: This meditation guides you toward finding ease and satisfaction in the present moment without needing to add anything extra to feel good.
meditations.title: Contentment

meditations.description: Loving-kindness can be a silent, undercover superpower. Learn to animate your practice of loving-kindness.
meditations.title: Loving-kindness + Walking

meditations.description: Science has shown that loving-kindness can reduce negative emotions, develop positive mindstates, and improve life satisfaction – learn how.
meditations.title: Loving-Kindness

meditations.description: This meditation gives you a comprehensive way to get in touch with your body and offers an invigorating way to attend to the present moment.
meditations.title: Body Scan

meditations.description: Noting practice is one of the simplest ways to step out of a reactive habit pattern. This practice can help when working with addiction.
meditations.title: Noting Practice

meditations.description: Learn to use the very simple feeling of the body as a gateway back into the present moment, when your mind is going off the rails.
meditations.title: The Monkey Mind

meditations.description: Distractions can actually become essential helpers in the practice of mindfulness. We just have to learn how to welcome them.
meditations.title: Using Distractions

meditations.description: Joseph explains that we're building a capacity to be with experience exactly as it's unfolding, moment to moment.
meditations.title: Greater Ease, Greater Freedom

meditations.description: In this session, practice seeing the difficulties of others as a way to open your heart and develop a mind of stability and support.
meditations.title: Seeing Things Clearly

meditations.description: Some people naturally feel happy when others are happy. For most of us, it's a training. Sharon is here to help.
meditations.title: Feeling Happy For Others

meditations.description: Don't let your doubts throw you off! When we learn how to detect doubting thoughts and let them pass, they no longer derail our practice.
meditations.title: Doubting Mind

meditations.description: Too much comparison can lead to bitterness and resentment. Feel better about yourself by practicing goodwill for others.
meditations.title: An Endless Cycle

meditations.description: Joseph walks you through the basics of using mental notes, helping you develop a tool for connecting with momentary experience.
meditations.title: Mental Noting

meditations.description: Meditation doesn't require a ton of effort. Find an easy and natural way to come back to the present moment when you get distracted.
meditations.title: Effortlessness

meditations.description: Noticing how we respond to sounds develops our mindfulness, so that we are less easily distracted throughout the day.
meditations.title: Using Sound

meditations.description: Learn how to become mindful of desire, creating more room for choice instead of automatically reaching for the thirtieth cookie.
meditations.title: Desire

meditations.description: We're far more intertwined with others than we usually realize. Recognizing this can spark a satisfying sense of appreciation and kindness.
meditations.title: Interconnected

meditations.description: Using a body scan, Jud helps you get in touch with the natural satisfaction of curiosity.
meditations.title: Positive and Negative Reinforcement

meditations.description: In this body scan meditation, you'll learn to differentiate the experience of stress and tension in the body from the urge to eat.
meditations.title: Just Paying Attention

meditations.description: Failing is a natural part of learning, but we often beat ourselves up when we make mistakes. Jud helps us work with the self-critical mind.
meditations.title: Beating Ourselves Up

meditations.description: Joseph shows us how to bring mindfulness to a moment of greed or aversion, rather than mindlessly following the impulse.
meditations.title: When Greed Wins

meditations.description: When you find yourself struggling during meditation, try accepting the experience. Often the sense of difficulty will disappear.
meditations.title: Struggle

meditations.description: Impermanence is natural. Nothing lasts forever, and everything is in flux. What if you could reorient your mind to this fundamental truth?
meditations.title: Exploring the Mind

meditations.description: Why are we doing this meditation thing again? Here, Joseph offers an inspirational booster shot, reminding us of the ultimate aim.
meditations.title: What We Learn

meditations.description: Take a moment to pay attention to the good things that are already here, and get in touch with the basic satisfaction of being alive.
meditations.title: Next Pleasant Thing

meditations.description: When we pay attention to subtle feelings, we build the ability to respond appropriately rather than react habitually.
meditations.title: Feeling Tone

meditations.description: Investigate the impulse to move or act, and see how this allows greater space and freedom of choice over the course of the day.
meditations.title: The “About to” Moment

meditations.description: Cut through the illusion of thoughts about the past or future so you can relate to them more clearly.
meditations.title: Past, Present, Future

meditations.description: Thoughts trigger emotions and emotions trigger thoughts. Curiosity can help us see these dynamics without getting lost in them.
meditations.title: Thoughts and Emotions

meditations.description: When you experience and acknowledge the truth of change, you're less likely to be swept away by your thoughts and emotions.
meditations.title: Everything Changes

meditations.description: Sharon helps you see that loving-kindness is something that's freely given and doesn't try to hold on to a particular outcome.
meditations.title: Expectations Make Us Suffer

meditations.description: Even our most intense cravings are just passing thoughts. When we build our trust in this fact, they begin to have less of a hold on us.
meditations.title: Resisting Our Cravings

meditations.description: Loving-kindness can sound incredibly sappy, but it's really just a way of paying attention. Sharon makes it simple.
meditations.title: Intro to Loving-kindness

meditations.description: Many of us eat when we feel stressed, even if we're not hungry. We can learn to navigate that urge when it comes up by sensing into the body.
meditations.title: Learning from Strong Urges

meditations.description: In this practice, Sharon introduces loving-kindness for a benefactor, encouraging you to keep the practice simple.
meditations.title: Choosing Phrases

meditations.description: Giving someone your attention is a sign of sincere generosity. Offer the gift of attention and care in this guided practice with Sharon.
meditations.title: Freely Given Gift

meditations.description: In this guided body scan, learn to get free of self-judgment. Discern which habits are helping you and which ones are holding you back.
meditations.title: Seeing Clearly

meditations.description: Too many expectations can lead to disappointment. This meditation helps you avoid preconceived notions and see what is already there.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Just reading the title of today's session, could make your meditation easier and your life less stressful. Enjoy the calming wisdom from Joseph in today's meditation.
meditations.title: Be Aware and Don’t Cling

meditations.description: Accepting the unpleasant: easier said than done. Joseph demonstrates how to overcome reactivity and build the skill of acceptance.
meditations.title: Accepting the Unpleasant

meditations.description: Joseph helps us become mindful of rushing. If you've ever rushed, or think you might in the future, this session will pay dividends.
meditations.title: Rushing

meditations.description: Joseph helps you see how you might be sweeping emotions under the rug. He provides a framework to investigate them more productively.
meditations.title: Accepting Difficult Emotions

meditations.description: So much dissatisfaction comes from wanting other people to be different. Joseph gets at the root of wanting others to change.
meditations.title: Wanting Others to be Mindful

meditations.description: Oren introduces a guided reflection to help you come back to the present moment as a baseline for effective communication.
meditations.title: The Habit of Being Here

meditations.description: Some thoughts are skillful and some are not. Joseph helps us see the difference and cultivate those which bring greater happiness.
meditations.title: Skillful and Unskillful Thoughts

meditations.description: Ever watched a movie to zone out? Joseph helps you watch your own mental movie, seeing thoughts perform on the screen of your awareness.
meditations.title: Thought Game

meditations.description: The more you cultivate loving-kindness in meditation, the more you'll see in your life. Sharon helps you connect meditation with action.
meditations.title: Ethics

meditations.description: Joseph helps us see the ways in which we're reactive, guiding us to practice emotional dexterity in the moments we need it the most.
meditations.title: Learning from Afflictive Emotions

meditations.description: In this guided meditation, Joseph delivers a friendly introduction to this timeless practice.
meditations.title: Meditation: Simple, But Not Easy

meditations.description: The idea of generosity can cause fear about giving up things you might need in the future. Sharon helps release this sense of restriction.
meditations.title: Practicing Generosity

meditations.description: Concentration can feel really effortful. Sharon helps us see how concentration is actually more about letting go than hanging on.
meditations.title: Letting Go

meditations.description: Many experiences arise and pass between breaths. Stay with the pause between inhalation and exhalation, and be aware of awareness itself.
meditations.title: Space Between Breaths

meditations.description: Rather than beating yourself up for your alleged shortcomings, you can learn to bounce back from your mistakes with kindness toward yourself.
meditations.title: Self-Compassion

meditations.description: You can be with joy and you can be with sorrow. Sharon helps us stay present with whatever is happening in a fresh and inspiring way.
meditations.title: How We Relate

meditations.description: In the midst of emotions, the mind goes from one extreme to another. Sharon shows us how equanimity can help us navigate life's demands.
meditations.title: A Balanced Perspective

meditations.description: Sharon explains that compassion practice, especially for difficult people, doesn't mean you're condoning their actions.
meditations.title: A Skillful Response

meditations.description: In meditation, we often think that we are "watching" or "observing" our minds. Joseph helps us change our language, and thus our experience.
meditations.title: Feel, Don't Observe

meditations.description: Gaining insight into the empty nature of thoughts can help you unhook from them. The only power thoughts have is the power you give them.
meditations.title: What is a Thought?

meditations.description: Loving-kindness might sound like it belongs in a Hallmark greeting card, but Sharon explains that it doesn't have to be warm and fuzzy.
meditations.title: An Experiment

meditations.description: Miscommunication can lead to awkward or unfortunate encounters. Oren encourages you to make sure you've really heard what someone has said.
meditations.title: Am I Understanding You?

meditations.description: In this meditation, Oren helps you identify what your needs are and how they are central to communication.
meditations.title: Meeting Needs

meditations.description: Plunging into a conversation with a pre-planned agenda is a recipe for disaster. This meditation guides you to respond in a more genuine way.
meditations.title: From a Place of Curiosity

meditations.description: No matter what trips your mind takes during meditation, you can always return to the breath for a graceful landing back in the present.
meditations.title: There’s Always the Breath

meditations.description: Joseph strips mindfulness down to its simplest element: remembering.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: In today's guided mindfulness practice, Joseph strips mindfulness down to its simplest element: remembering.
meditations.title: Remembering

meditations.description: Join Joseph to develop clarity and precision in your meditation. This will translate into clarity and discernment in your everyday life.
meditations.title: Precision in Mental Noting

meditations.description: It's easy to blame someone else. This meditation will help you be more objective and avoid judgment until you understand what's happening.
meditations.title: Making Observations (Not Judgments)

meditations.description: Joseph uses soft mental notes to help you see the causes and conditions of emotional states, and the open sky that holds these experiences.
meditations.title: Open Sky of the Mind

meditations.description: Connect with your breath, body and emotional life in this simple practice, and relax into the reality that emotions are part of being alive.
meditations.title: Feelings and Emotions

meditations.description: Feeling heard is a key aspect of communication. Learn to close the loop by making sure the other person understands what you've said.
meditations.title: Staying Connected

meditations.description: Oren walks you through a time when your emotions were triggered during a conversation as a way of cultivating more emotional self-awareness.
meditations.title: What Emotions Feel Like

meditations.description: When we come to the table with competing needs, it helps to be clear and communicative. Magic happens when we're willing to stay open.
meditations.title: Proposing Solutions

meditations.description: A lot of mindfulness is about being ok not knowing. Especially when relating to others, comfort with uncertainty opens the playing field.
meditations.title: Being Okay with Uncertainty

meditations.description: Oren helps you catch your breath and not get carried away by emotions, helping you direct attention to bodily sensations.
meditations.title: Steady In the Face of Strong Emotions

meditations.description: Everyone can communicate, but not everyone can communicate skillfully. Oren shows us how to build this mindfulness skill.
meditations.title: It Takes Practice

meditations.description: Want to know what's going on for you, so you can empathize with others? This meditation can improve your conversations and relationships.
meditations.title: Inner and Outer Awareness

meditations.description: When you eat mindfully, you see that food is not the enemy. Jud explains that it's easier to make healthy choices this way.
meditations.title: Food is not the Enemy

meditations.description: The moment you notice craving, you often have the urgent impulse to fill the void. Find how to nourish yourself and ride out the sensation.
meditations.title: Turning Toward Cravings

meditations.description: Want an excuse to meditate with a chocolate chip cookie? In this meditation you'll explore mindful eating with whatever snack you have handy.
meditations.title: Just Pay Attention

meditations.description: Ever had a dream so real you woke up completely disoriented? Joseph helps you see how this happens during your waking life.
meditations.title: Dreaming Myself Into Existence

meditations.description: In this meditation, Sharon outlines an age-old meditation practice that is simple, but can have surprisingly profound results.
meditations.title: Feeling the Breath

meditations.description: Your mind can be overwhelmingly convincing and thoughts can feel all-powerful. Joseph helps you see what thoughts are really made of.
meditations.title: Pulling Back the Curtain

meditations.description: It's easy to depend on intensity in order to feel alive. Refocus your life, getting back in touch with the satisfaction of the present.
meditations.title: Concentration is a Skill

meditations.description: Settle into the flow and change in this guided practice with Joseph, exploring a fundamental attribute of being alive.
meditations.title: Stone Walls

meditations.description: Joseph guides you in paying attention to the quiet, the pauses, the place between breaths, and the silence between thoughts.
meditations.title: Exploring Silence

meditations.description: Mental noting is the platform for mindfulness. Sharon helps us see what's happening right now and note it without elaboration or judgement.
meditations.title: Noting the Breath

meditations.description: The real power of meditation comes when you investigate the teachings for yourself. Joseph shows how this makes mindfulness natural and easy.
meditations.title: Investigate for Yourself

meditations.description: Sometimes mindfulness isn't enough - you need some wisdom. This meditation uses wisdom to help you see the impermanent nature of experience.
meditations.title: The Watchman and Investigative Reporter

meditations.description: The breath is not as simple as you think. Dive even deeper in this meditation by noting the space that surrounds each inhale and exhale.
meditations.title: Breath, Not Breath

meditations.description: Joseph helps you realize that it's possible to enjoy a pleasant experience without habitually desiring that it continue forever.
meditations.title: Separating Desire from What’s Pleasant

meditations.description: Feeling restless or scattered? Counting each inhale can help you feel confident that you're on track.
meditations.title: Counting the Breath

meditations.description: Sharon guides you to seeing deeply into the nature of impermanence, no matter where you are, right here in the present moment. Enjoy!
meditations.title: Flow of Sensations

meditations.description: Do you have a death grip on the breath when you meditate? Sharon will help you find the balance between energy and tranquility.
meditations.title: Balance

meditations.description: A hallmark of a steady mind is that our practice is not derailed by distractions. Instead, they simply become a part of our meditation.
meditations.title: Being Mindful of Distractions

meditations.description: Meditation is the training ground for how to live. You see the same desires and fears and joys. Sharon helps us develop this wisdom.
meditations.title: The Training Ground

meditations.description: This meditation will help you see your feelings more clearly and quickly, helping you choose whether to act them out.
meditations.title: We Have Choices

meditations.description: Many people believe that it's hard to meditate. Alexis helps us begin to realize that a moment of mindfulness is actually not difficult.
meditations.title: It’s Simple

meditations.description: This practice plants seeds for integrating mindfulness throughout your day. It's not grand or showy, just small gestures of recognition.
meditations.title: Light Reminders

meditations.description: Learn about the three jobs in meditation: 1) Relate to experience in a skillful way, 2) Remember to be aware, 3) Keep balance in the mind.
meditations.title: Three Jobs

meditations.description: Alexis reminds you that meditation is really simple. All you need to do is check what's happening in the present. Are you aware? Of what?
meditations.title: Am I Aware?

meditations.description: When we take the time to notice, we see that everyone is doing their best. This helps us stay more connected and compassionate.
meditations.title: Harder than it Looks

meditations.description: Does focusing on the breath feel forced? Alexis helps you find a sensation that is interesting to you, using that as a meditation anchor.
meditations.title: The Mind was Sleepy

meditations.description: We all have internal weather patterns. Through practice, we can find relief in letting them move through.
meditations.title: Arising and Falling

meditations.description: Empathy is a core skill for connecting with others. Oren investigates the ways you can empathetically relate to those around you.
meditations.title: A Good Friend

meditations.description: Alexis helps us realize that thinking (even during meditation) is normal and natural, and doesn't get in the way of the practice.
meditations.title: Thinking Mind Isn’t the Enemy

meditations.description: Canadian Jeff Warren helps Americans grapple with election stress by gaining wide perspective, times one billion, in this guided meditation.
meditations.title: Powers of Ten

meditations.description: Freaked out about politics? Sharon helps us regain balance, letting go of the distress that election campaigns can cause.
meditations.title: Back to Balance

meditations.description: Even in the midst of chaos, we can orient to the center of our bodies. Going inward helps us know what to say and do out there in the world.
meditations.title: Coming to Center

meditations.description: Passively consuming media can let your emotions and fears run wild. Bringing mindful attention to the experience can help.
meditations.title: Triggered by the Media?

meditations.description: There's a difference between feeling angry and stewing. Sharon helps you dig yourself out of the emotional swamp and clear the air.
meditations.title: Feeling Anger

meditations.description: Anushka will help you be mindful, relaxed, and open to the entire field of hearing in this short meditation. Try it anytime, anywhere.
meditations.title: Field of Hearing

meditations.description: The body is not an inert thing your brain happens to be lugging around. Anushka helps you focus on the body as a gateway to presence.
meditations.title: A Moment of Mindfulness

meditations.description: Anushka explains how awareness is open, receptive, and can easily receive the things that arise in your experience.
meditations.title: Satellite Dish

meditations.description: Anushka helps you experience kindness as something that is always available and inexhaustible, so you can tap into it whenever you want.
meditations.title: Field of Kindness

meditations.description: Sick of being told to focus on the breath? Try connecting with other parts of the body as a way of returning to the present moment.
meditations.title: Touch Points

meditations.description: Relax your body from head to toe with this tried-and-true meditation technique taught by one of the masters.
meditations.title: Body Scan

meditations.description: Let go of the need to curate the perfect meditation soundscape, and use the rising and passing away of noise to sharpen your attention.
meditations.title: Sounds

meditations.description: The breath is nothing more than a useful way to stay present. Sharon helps you broaden your awareness to include seeing and hearing.
meditations.title: Cycle of Senses

meditations.description: Mantras are simple, repeated phrases to help build concentration. Sharon helps you find the right mantra to develop mindful awareness.
meditations.title: What’s a Mantra?

meditations.description: Sharons explains that the trick to walking meditations is bringing awareness to an act that we normally do quite mechanically.
meditations.title: Walking

meditations.description: The art of concentration is a continual letting go. Join Sharon to experience the power of letting go, moment by moment by moment.
meditations.title: Employing These Techniques

meditations.description: Meditation doesn't require going soft. Harness your mental agility and toughness in this practice from George.
meditations.title: The Mental Game

meditations.description: Mindfulness is the ability to be still in the midst of experience. This meditation helps you find the space between stimulus and response.
meditations.title: Be Still And Know

meditations.description: Refine the most important skill in meditation, returning to the present moment. George guides you like a coach in your corner.
meditations.title: Steadiness of Mind

meditations.description: Having the audacity to get comfortable with discomfort can be an empowering way to live life more fully. George shares what he's learned.
meditations.title: Know Thyself

meditations.description: Want to be more optimistic or motivated? George helps you flip the switch and wake up to a fresh state of mind.
meditations.title: Change the Mindset

meditations.description: Balancing between trying too hard and getting lazy in your practice is an important way to stay on track. This leads to a steady mind.
meditations.title: Clearly Knowing

meditations.description: In this meditation, George helps you notice your patterns and find new ways of seeing yourself in the world.
meditations.title: Emotional Blueprints

meditations.description: George helps you skillfully snap back when you've made a mistake, letting go of the drama to begin again.
meditations.title: Back On Track

meditations.description: Have you ever doubted yourself? What about your meditation? George helps you use curiosity to short-circuit the spiral of insecurity.
meditations.title: Seeing Clearly

meditations.description: Where there is fear, there are seeds for compassion. Learn how to sit with fear, not lose yourself, and act with a clear mind.
meditations.title: Antidote to Fear

meditations.description: Taking stock of your breath, body, and emotions helps you find the joy of learning for learning's sake.
meditations.title: Joyful Journey

meditations.description: Sometimes we only have a minute in to spare between the madness.  Here's a 60 second mindfulness boost to supercharge the day.
meditations.title: 1 Minute to Sanity

meditations.description: Expectations of perfection run rampant in the holiday season. Sharon helps us find a sense of "enough-ness" and inner wellbeing.
meditations.title: Holiday Expectations

meditations.description: Master the art of regulating impulsive urges before acting out on them by using a tried and true technique for widthstanding cravings.
meditations.title: SURF the Urge

meditations.description: Need a confidence boost in your practice? Your belief that you're the world's worst meditator is actually a positive sign.
meditations.title: Proof That You Don't Suck at Meditation

meditations.description: Dan guides you through using the breath and body to strengthen your attentional muscles when the mind goes nuts.
meditations.title: Biceps Curls For Your Brain

meditations.description: Don't let the stress of last-minute shopping, grumpy relatives, or sticky candy canes separate you from your sanity during the holidays.
meditations.title: Holiday Limbic Hijack

meditations.description: Sharon teaches you to work with the fleeting nature of attention, helping you learn to refocus your attention when it wanders off.
meditations.title: The Truth of Change

meditations.description: The three most important words in mindfulness are "simply begin again." This meditation focuses on the key to all meditation techniques.
meditations.title: Simply Begin Again

meditations.description: This meditation helps you power down, softening your body and mind with every exhale to sink into a deeper state of tranquility.
meditations.title: Power Down

meditations.description: Jeff leads you into noticing and appreciating that our body is absolutely teeming with life, movement, and energy.
meditations.title: Move Your Body

meditations.description: Explore the freedom of space using sounds, the volume of the body, and fleeting experiences that move effortlessly through your awareness.
meditations.title: Top Down

meditations.description: Recruit your imagination to establish a clear sense of physical boundaries, regulating your system when things feel frazzled.
meditations.title: Containment

meditations.description: It's natual to want to get rid of pain. But when we actually "love it to death," as Jeff says, we might be amazed at how that changes things.
meditations.title: Zooming in on Pain

meditations.description: Seeing other people happy makes us happy. Generate some joy with Jeff in this guided imagination practice.
meditations.title: Practicing Joy

meditations.description: Jeff helps explore the quality of your thoughts, showing you how they are not, in fact, solid or real.
meditations.title: Where is a Thought?

meditations.description: Jeff helps you build a comprehensive mindfulness toolbox that can be used anytime.
meditations.title: Mindfulness Skill Set

meditations.description: Get curious about discomfort. Ask questions about it. Become a meditation warrior as Jeff helps you investigate unpleasant sensations.
meditations.title: The Ninja Move

meditations.description: Feeling the breath can be really pleasant. Enjoy the simplicity of just knowing the breath coming in and going out.
meditations.title: Enjoying the Breath

meditations.description: In this meditation, you'll build up the mental muscles of concentration, equanimity, and friendliness.
meditations.title: Building Mental Muscles

meditations.description: Jeff guides you to imagine energy moving up through your body from the ground, helping you stay grounded during difficult moments.
meditations.title: Ground Yourself

meditations.description: Feel like you are juggling all of life's demands? This tour of meditation techniques will help you regain balance and come back to center.
meditations.title: Centeredness

meditations.description: Sound during meditation doesn't have to be the enemy. Jeff helps you reframe it as a tactic to expand your awareness.
meditations.title: Surround Sound

meditations.description: One of Jeff's favorites. Rather than use a predesignated method, we'll practice not having a clue what's going on. It's quite freeing!
meditations.title: Don't Know Mind

meditations.description: In this meditation, Jeff guides you to become a kinder version of yourself and explores the reasonableness of wishing other people well.
meditations.title: Reasonableness of Loving-kindness

meditations.description: We are hard-coded to respond to others' suffering. This can be lovely, but it can also cause burnout. Jeff helps us avoid the latter.
meditations.title: Compassion vs. Empathy

meditations.description: Jeff uses breath and visualization to reveal the inherent interconnectedness of all things, helping you see all there is to be grateful for.
meditations.title: Interconnection + Gratitude

meditations.description: Let your senses guide your meditation. Shinzen introduces the practice of choice-less awareness, helping you be with life exactly as it is.
meditations.title: Scattered

meditations.description: This tongue-in-cheek meditation will help bring some lightheartedness to the way you think of a difficult person in your life.
meditations.title: Kindness for A-holes (NSFW)

meditations.description: How did you ever end up with an app for meditation? If this question resonates, then this hilarious meditation from Jeff is for you.
meditations.title: What The Hell Am I Doing Here?

meditations.description: Sometimes your head is just full of garbage. Sick and tired of the stream of junk clogging up your mind? Jeff knows exactly what to do...
meditations.title: Flush Your Thoughts

meditations.description: Thoughts just come and go. We get ourselves into trouble by staking our claim in them. What if we could see them as fleeting and pay no mind?
meditations.title: Thoughts Are Not Solid

meditations.description: You know you're not the center of the universe. In this meditation Anushka helps you lay the foundation to actually see this for yourself.
meditations.title: Mindful Attention

meditations.description: Each breath is unique. Some are big, some are small, and some make that awkward nose whistle. Get curious about what will be next.
meditations.title: Notice Change In The Breath

meditations.description: Anushka helps you see that your physical form isn't really your core. By focusing on momentary sensations, we see that it's fully transient.
meditations.title: This Physical Body

meditations.description: Having an itch can be an incredibly annoying experience, but it turns out it's also a great opportunity to notice change in your body.
meditations.title: Curious About An Itch

meditations.description: We put so much stock in thoughts that arise and dissolve. Explore the nature of thoughts to become familiar with how they work.
meditations.title: Tricky To Catch

meditations.description: Sounds come and go on their own. This meditation focuses on hearing as a way to experience the impermanent nature of life.
meditations.title: Field Of Sound

meditations.description: Everything is subject to constant change. We can connect to that reality by noticing fleeting sensations in the body.
meditations.title: An Inherent Instability

meditations.description: Even the fiercest storms eventually blow over. We could view our emotions in just the same way. It helps if we can find a baseline of ease.
meditations.title: Just Like Weather Patterns

meditations.description: Thoughts show up uninvited, but no matter what they are, they never stick around for long. Explore the ephemeral nature of thoughts.
meditations.title: Thoughts Lack Solidity

meditations.description: Change is inevitable. Experience the joy of change, by letting willingness and curiosity guide your practice.
meditations.title: Change Is Unreliable

meditations.description: The mind is a shapeshifter. When you look closely, you'll find that what you thought was solid and fixed is actually fluid and ever-changing.
meditations.title: No Me at the Center

meditations.description: Relax your sense of control and explore the idea that there's no inherent, controlling entity at the center of your experience.
meditations.title: Who Is Running The Show?

meditations.description: In this meditation, Anushka helps you see that not all thoughts are true or permanent.
meditations.title: We Believe What We Think

meditations.description: With practice comes insight. Over time, our emotions have less power over us, and we have more freedom to choose how we respond to them.
meditations.title: Changing Nature of Emotions

meditations.description: Learn to notice the impulse to place happiness on temporary circumstances, and develop patience in returning to the present moment.
meditations.title: Not Under Our Control

meditations.description: Your body is constantly aware and in the present. Use your body to leave the whirlwind of thoughts and return to what is actually happening.
meditations.title: Attending to Awareness

meditations.description: Most of us live a sedentary lifestyle. Mix it up with mobile mindfulness. Pam helps us turn a casual stroll into a meditation experience.
meditations.title: Walking With Awareness

meditations.description: Ease your anxiety in a single minute. Sebene's got your back.
meditations.title: For An Anxious Moment

meditations.description: Sebene guides you through using physical touchpoints to reduce anxiety. This is a great alternative to focusing on breathing.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Stay calm, cool, and centered – even in the craziest circumstances. Seb shows you how to get grounded fast in today's meditation.
meditations.title: Working With Anxiety

meditations.description: Combine the power of loving-kindness meditation and a carefully crafted body scan in this tried-and-true practice.
meditations.title: Body Scan For Pain

meditations.description: The mind can easily ruminate on what has gone wrong and what could be better. Sebene helps you feel a sense of basic joy and appreciation.
meditations.title: Gratitude

meditations.description: Sebene uses the sensation of gravity and the feeling of the breath, helping you return into your actual, embodied experience.
meditations.title: The Present Moment

meditations.description: Joseph helps you investigate the complaining mind. When you're aware of complaints, they evaporate, opening up space for more satisfaction.
meditations.title: The Complaining Mind

meditations.description: The three most important words in mindfulness are "simply begin again." This meditation focuses on the key to all meditation techniques.
meditations.title: Simply Begin Again

meditations.description: How to use the feelings in your body to stay focused in meditation.
meditations.title: Sensations in the Body

meditations.description: Create more ease of mind with the simple strategy Joseph learned on a bus trip through India.
meditations.title: Bus Trip to Kashmir

meditations.description: Sometimes in meditation, your body revolts. Waves of sleepiness wash over. The urge to flee overtakes you. Joseph helps with these obstacles.
meditations.title: Drowsiness and Restlessness

meditations.description: Left unchecked, our thoughts have huge influence over our lives. When we become aware of them, though, we see that they are insubstantial.
meditations.title: Dictators of the Mind

meditations.description: If strong emotions come up, don't run away. Investigate. Feel them fully, without getting lost in them. This is a game-changing skill.
meditations.title: Opening to Strong Emotions

meditations.description: Judgments can sometimes be useful, but they often get in our way. Joseph talks about how to weaken the pattern of judging in our minds.
meditations.title: The Judging Mind

meditations.description: How a quieter mind can improve your relationships with everyone in your life.
meditations.title: Quiet and Connected

meditations.description: When you watch thoughts in your mind, seeing them come and go, the voice in your head can lose much of its dictatorial authority.
meditations.title: What is a Thought?

meditations.description: A personal story from Joseph about his own struggles with fear.
meditations.title: Fear

meditations.description: Sharon helps you turn away from what's wrong with you, leading you to recognize and reflect on the good things about yourself.
meditations.title: Remembering Your Goodness

meditations.description: Instead of letting your inner critic control you, turn it into a caricature so you can find a little space in the relationship.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: You don't have to beat yourself up. Learn to take the power back from the judgmental voice in your head in today's session from Sharon.
meditations.title: Dressing Up The Inner Critic

meditations.description: In this short session from Sharon, learn a time-tested technique to develop a meditative relationship with difficult emotions.
meditations.title: Difficult Emotions with R.A.I.N.

meditations.description: What is real love, without the trappings? In this reflection, you'll learn how to tap into feelings of love while maintaining clarity.
meditations.title: Real Love in Relationships

meditations.description: If we pay attention, we are all interconnected. This meditation helps you carry this perspective with you throughout your day.
meditations.title: Contemplating Interconnection

meditations.description: When we pay attention to the fact that we are all in this together, it becomes easier to feel care for others.
meditations.title: Sharing The Love

meditations.description: Stubborn emotions can feel like rocks lodged in your gut. Lessen the impact of your emotions by paying attention to how they show up.
meditations.title: Keeping an Even Keel

meditations.description: Connect to your feelings and emotions, coming back to what matters most. You'll become stabler and more centered in whatever you're feeling.
meditations.title: Back to the Breath

meditations.description: Using stories from teaching mindfulness to schoolkids, Oren teaches how to name your emotions and change the way you relate to them.
meditations.title: Naming Emotions

meditations.description: We all need acknowledgment and connection in our lives. Oren explains how bringing awareness to our emotions can help us connect.
meditations.title: Emotional Awareness

meditations.description: Oren helps you establish a balanced response to emotions, where you don't try to make an emotion go away or fix it.
meditations.title: Relating to Our Emotions

meditations.description: Oren helps you see emotions like an artist or scientist, stepping back and taking stock. You'll be able to find more balance as a result.
meditations.title: Creating Space

meditations.description: Just like visitors, emotions arrive, stay for a while, and then leave. See the changing and impersonal nature of emotions in this meditation.
meditations.title: Just Another Emotion

meditations.description: Feel like you are in a never-ending boxing match against the critical voice in your head? Learn how to duck its punches and end the fight.
meditations.title: Don't Fight The Inner Critic

meditations.description: Pam examines the value of listening. Hearing what is being said can be a useful springboard for fresh and creative problem solving.
meditations.title: Listening in an Age of Polarization

meditations.description: Current events can bring up a lot of strong feelings. When we look at our reactions more closely, we might be surprised at what we discover.
meditations.title: Polarization Fatigue

meditations.description: When people are irritating, the best we can do is work on our own reactivity. This practice will help you interact more skillfully.
meditations.title: Dealing with Difficult People

meditations.description: Sebene helps you take a break from information overload and return to the basic experience of the breath and body.
meditations.title: Getting out of Your Head

meditations.description: The benefits of meditation do not discriminate. This short meditation is the perfect thing to do no matter what your state of mind is like.
meditations.title: Happiness for Grumpy People

meditations.description: You can't always get what you want, but if you meditate a little, you just might find you get what you need.
meditations.title: Meditation for Pessimists

meditations.description: Social media can be a powerful time suck and eat up mental energy. Reset by bringing a mindful attitude to the mindless scrolling.
meditations.title: Facebook Intoxication

meditations.description: This meditation uses your feet, hands and belly to help you get out of your head, let go of pressure and feel a little lighter.
meditations.title: Working with Stress In The Body

meditations.description: You don't have to be a guru to find wisdom in your own mind. Learn to see how you filter your experiences, and see things more clearly.
meditations.title: Looking at Experience Wisely

meditations.description: In this meditation, Sebene teaches you a form of deep abdominal breathing that's been observed to correlate with relaxed brainwave patterns.
meditations.title: Easing Stress

meditations.description: Meditation uses ordinary experience to develop awareness. That's it. Alexis helps you use whatever happens around you to create mindfulness.
meditations.title: What's Obvious?

meditations.description: Sebene shows how mindfulness can provide some relief from the mental symptoms of pain, taking the intensity down a few notches.
meditations.title: Bring Awareness to Pain

meditations.description: Be more intentional about time spent walking, no matter where you are going, by integrating mindfulness into your strolls.
meditations.title: Aware While Walking

meditations.description: Getting bored of paying attention to the breath? Matthew helps you use hearing to develop mindfulness, relaxation, and balance.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Do you hear what I hear? Tune in to the sensual experience of hearing in today's meditation from Matthew. With his guidance, you can use the field of sound to develop mindfulness no matter where you are.
meditations.title: The World of Sound

meditations.description: Jay helps you to treat the mind as if were an open sky, where thoughts, feelings, and emotions are just clouds passing through.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: In today's meditation, Jay guides you through the practice of feeling the mind as if were an open sky, where thoughts, feelings, and emotions are just clouds passing through.
meditations.title: Open Awareness

meditations.description: JoAnna helps you find your footing in the present, so you can engage more effectively in the world.
meditations.title: Live A Little more Free

meditations.description: The way you act and speak impacts everyone around you. What if you could tune in and become more aware and skillful in your actions?
meditations.title: Our Actions Matter

meditations.description: How do you react when you experience aversion, fear, dislike, or hatred? We'll explore how to work with these impulses more wisely.
meditations.title: When Is It OK to Kill?

meditations.description: JoAnna provides a perspective on engaging with irritation, helping you change your experience of discomfort into something positive.
meditations.title: When Discomfort Arises

meditations.description: Constantly wanting the next best thing is misery-making. JoAnna skillfully helps you stop the wanting mind from running you off the rails.
meditations.title: If Only I Could Have...

meditations.description: JoAnna helps you see how desire yanks you around, guiding you to work with these experiences more deliberately.
meditations.title: What Does Wanting Feel Like?

meditations.description: Sexuality can be a beautiful thing, but it can also cause a lot of harm. JoAnna explores how to have a wise relationship with sexual desire.
meditations.title: Paying Attention to Desire

meditations.description: Mindfully explore experiences around sexuality. Getting to know ourselves better in this way is key in working skillfully with this energy.
meditations.title: Sexuality in the Body

meditations.description: When you pay attention to your thinking, you may see negative self-talk is running the show. You'll see how you can be kinder to yourself.
meditations.title: How We Talk To Ourselves

meditations.description: This session helps you reflect on the ways speech is used unconsciously, and helps you bring more mindfulness to your speech.
meditations.title: When Words Cause Harm

meditations.description: JoAnna helps you tune into what is going on in your body and mind before you try to numb or change the way you are feeling.
meditations.title: Checking Out

meditations.description: JoAnna looks at why and when the mind decides to check out, and how to come back to the fullness of your experience.
meditations.title: When We Feel Numb

meditations.description: JoAnna helps you think through how to live your life, focusing on nourishing yourself and those around you.
meditations.title: How Do You Want To Live?

meditations.description: In this gentle meditation, Sebene offers support for grief. She guides you through a practice of kindness and compassion for yourself.
meditations.title: Working With Grief

meditations.description: Life can feel like it is an endless sequence of extremes. Alexis helps you stay balanced no matter what chaos is happening around you.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: In today’s session, Alexis helps you develop an increased state of equipoise that can help you stay balanced no matter what chaos is happening around you.
meditations.title: Balance Is Key

meditations.description: Not telling the truth can weigh us down. In this practice, we'll dig into the experience of lying, to notice how it affects our experience.
meditations.title: Truth Telling Practice

meditations.description: Desire isn't always a bad thing, but learning how to sit with it can free you up to act more wisely and not cause harm while in its throes.
meditations.title: Objects of Desire

meditations.description: In this meditation, JoAnna lays out a series of principles that can help you pay more attention to how you act in the world.
meditations.title: Committing to Ethical Behavior

meditations.description: Taking stock of our actions and making generosity a guiding principle for our lives might actually make us happier. JoAnna shows us how.
meditations.title: Generosity Practice

meditations.description: See what it's like to be in the tangible, physical sensation of your emotional stories, and gain a bit of freedom.
meditations.title: Emotional Stories

meditations.description: Learn the backbone of meditation practice with JoAnna. You'll touch into two focal points: the breath and the body.
meditations.title: Simple Body Scan

meditations.description: JoAnna teaches you to stay with an open frame of mind, allowing thoughts and sensations to come and go within the space of awareness.
meditations.title: Choiceless Awareness

meditations.description: If meditation makes you break a sweat, you're probably trying too hard. This meditation helps you be relaxed and focused at the same time.
meditations.title: Relaxed Awareness

meditations.description: Sometimes it pays to keep things simple. Jeff leads us towards appreciating the simplicity of just feeling, and letting that be enough.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Enjoy the beautiful simplicity of today's mediation from Jeff. This is a practice to come back to again and again.
meditations.title: A Very Simple Meditation

meditations.description: This meditation incorporates insights from cognitive neuroscience, guiding you to attend to any sensation that captures your attention.
meditations.title: Open Monitoring

meditations.description: Dave guides you through switching between focus and letting the mind wander, so you can get a sense of what attention actually feels like.
meditations.title: What Attention Feels Like

meditations.description: Research shows that meditation can reduce the symptoms of anxiety. By focusing on physical sensations, you can experience this for yourself.
meditations.title: Body Scan for Anxiety

meditations.description: We live in an age of distraction. The good news is that we can decrease our mind wandering and build our attention through simple practice.
meditations.title: Sustaining Attention

meditations.description: When we're aware of sensations in our bodies, we can regulate the stress response in our brains. Better yet, this is a skill we can build!
meditations.title: Body Awareness

meditations.description: Neuroscientist Dave Vago helps you start reshaping the neurological underpinnings that are responsible for emotional reactivity.
meditations.title: Cultivating Equanimity

meditations.description: Grateful people are happy people. In this reflection, Cory will guide you in developing an honest appreciation for life.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Live well, and practice gratitude. Gladden your mind with today's meditation.
meditations.title: Cultivating Gratitude

meditations.description: Go for a walk with neuroscientist Dave Vago to learn about the benefits walking has for the brain, body, cognition and well-being.
meditations.title: Mindful Walking

meditations.description: Take walking meditation to the next level. Turn the jarring noise of traffic or chatter into a portable meditation practice.
meditations.title: Walking Through Sound

meditations.description: Let your phone's intelligence guide your meditation in this hilarious (and useful) meditation by Jeff Warren.
meditations.title: The Space Between Commands

meditations.description: The first thing you do in the morning sets the tone for the day. Try using body scans and deep breaths to start the day off right.
meditations.title: Before Getting Out of Bed

meditations.description: It's easy to get stuck not knowing what to do. This meditation provides some clarity, helping you make better choices and cause less harm.
meditations.title: Taking The Guidelines

meditations.description: Meditation isn't work. This session helps you enjoy the process of practicing mindfulness, turning it from a chore into a pleasure.
meditations.title: Enjoying the Body

meditations.description: This meditation walks you through developing a source of inner generosity.
meditations.title: Holiday Loving-kindness

meditations.description: Jeff helps you to see past the flashy showmanship of your thoughts, showing you the backdrop of cool, calm awareness.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Being dragged around by your thoughts consumes so much energy. Today's meditation from Jeff is the antidote. Start this meditation to build up the good habit of seeing thinking for what it is.
meditations.title: Catch Thinking In The Act

meditations.description: Concentration is the backbone of meditation. Strengthen your ability to return to the present with this basic, but essential, technique.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Kick the weekend off right. Strengthen your ability to connect to the present moment by practicing this basic, but essential, technique with Jeff.
meditations.title: Concentration 101

meditations.description: The breath is your most loyal groupie. It follows you everywhere. Use it to your advantage by taking ten good breaths to feel better.
meditations.title: Ten Good Breaths

meditations.description: Listen to this meditation before jumping into the shower, refreshing your mind and body at the same time.
meditations.title: In The Shower

meditations.description: Shift your attention from thinking and planning to being more present and jam out like the bathroom rock star you truly are.
meditations.title: Tooth Brushing

meditations.description: No matter how you feel or what's going on, it's possible to give yourself a break. Jeff's down-to-earth guidance will help lighten the load.
meditations.title: Giving a Shit About Yourself

meditations.description: Jeff leads you to take the laziest meditation posture you can imagine, then helps you cultivate a deep state of mental repose.
meditations.title: Taking Back Lazy

meditations.description: During any difficult emotion, you can use this pocket-sized meditation where you will recognize, accept, investigate, and notice experience.
meditations.title: RAIN

meditations.description: Jeff helps direct your attention to the mind's habituated ways of thinking to unlock new, more wholesome patterns.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Don't let neuroses run your life. In this meditation, Jeff helps direct your attention to the mind's habituated ways of thinking to unlock new, more useful patterns.
meditations.title: Investigating Patterns

meditations.description: Instead of fruitlessly trying to control everything in your life, take a lighter approach and throw a party for all that comes your way.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Today's session is a good vibe meditation from Jeff Warren, who teaches you how to stop resisting what you don't want and start building acceptance, easygoingness, and resilience.
meditations.title: Welcome To The Party

meditations.description: In this session from Jeff, learn a type of compassion that doesn't lead to burn out.
meditations.title: Smart Compassion

meditations.description: Begin to master the art of regulating impulsive urges before acting out.
meditations.title: SURF The Urge

meditations.description: Micromanaging your experience can be exhausting and impossible. Take a step back and get versed in doing absolutely nothing.
meditations.title: Do Nothing

meditations.description: Get a full mental workout in this meditation. Jeff helps you hit 5 key mindfulness bases for a well-rounded meditation practice.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: If Jeff was a personal trainer, today's meditation session would be his full body workout. Learn to develop 5 mental qualities for a well-rounded meditation practice.
meditations.title: Training The Mind

meditations.description: Jeff uses walking meditation to slow things down. You'll get up close and personal with the sensations of your feet and body.
meditations.title: Formal Walking

meditations.description: Walking doesn't have to be boring. Explore the wild side of ambulation with Jeff.
meditations.title: Informal Walking

meditations.description: Lace up and get in the zone with this running meditation inspired by Chief Moir from the Tempe Arizona Police Department.
meditations.title: Chief Moir Running Meditation

meditations.description: We let Jeff loose on his favorite topic: consciousness. This guided practice will expand your perspective and open up life's mysteries.
meditations.title: Mystical Good Times

meditations.description: Sharon teaches you a simple breathing technique to release tension and reduce the intensity of a painful experience.
meditations.title: Breathing To Release Pain

meditations.description: You'll learn to hold both pain and pleasure in your attention as a way of skillfully balancing your engagement with difficult sensations.
meditations.title: Finding Balance With Pain

meditations.description: Pain hurts, but adding on blame or shame creates unnecessary suffering. Sharon helps us see how some angst is entirely optional.
meditations.title: Pain Without Struggle

meditations.description: In this guided meditation designed for working with pain, Sharon teaches you how to deconstruct the experience of a single painful feeling.
meditations.title: Pain Doesn't Last

meditations.description: In this meditation, Sharon teaches you how to let go of worry and anxiety that come with pain, without rancor or judgment.
meditations.title: Reframing Pain

meditations.description: Science has shown that loving-kindness can reduce negative emotions, develop positive mindstates, and improve life satisfaction – learn how.
meditations.title: Loving-kindness

meditations.description: If you're sick, in pain, or want to develop a healthier relationship to your body, try this kind and transformative practice from Sharon.
meditations.title: Lovingkindness For The Body

meditations.description: JoAnna guides you through a practice of letting go of the emotional burdens that are weighing you down. You'll feel lighter and more free.
meditations.title: Forgiveness Meditation

meditations.description: As we start another day, it's easy to go on autopilot. With this morning meditation, relax and remind yourself that today is a new day.
meditations.title: A New Day

meditations.description: Is meditation the last thing you want to do right now? This one's for when closing your eyes and watching your breath sounds like torture.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Is meditation the last thing you want to do right now? Today's session from Matthew is your go-to practice for using humor and honesty to keep a healthy meditation habit going, even when you're just not that into it.
meditations.title: I Don't Want To Meditate

meditations.description: Commuting is one of the most stressful activities we engage in. Jay helps you appreciate your commute instead of rushing through it.
meditations.title: On The Way To Work

meditations.description: Morning meditation lets us settle before the day gets busy. Alexis helps you relax the mind by simply allowing experiences to happen.
meditations.title: Before The Day Begins

meditations.description: The more we fight against stress, the more tension we create. Learn how to soften your mind, turning tension into spaciousness.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: It's Friday, time to start letting all that accumulated stress from the crazy pace of the week unwind. Play this meditation from Cory to help you reset and start the weekend on the right foot.
meditations.title: Letting Stress Settle

meditations.description: Grief is part of what it means to care. There's no way around it. Learn how to move through the stages of grief with resilience and courage.
meditations.title: When Grief Arrives

meditations.description: Take a few minutes to relax. In this meditation, Sharon will lead you in tensing and then relaxing your face, hands, shoulders, and back.
meditations.title: Basic Relaxation

meditations.description: Take a few moments this morning to explore waking up and noticing sounds.
meditations.title: Waking With Sound

meditations.description: Self-compassion is powerful, but it's not always easy to acknowledge your own pain. This meditation helps you default to compassion.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Discover how meditation can help you build a healthier and healthier relationship to yourself. Joseph's got the daily dose of wisdom you need.
meditations.title: Self-Compassion

meditations.description: Caring about others' wellbeing actually enhances our own. Practice and see how this beautiful quality begins to transform your experience.
meditations.title: Compassion For Another

meditations.description: We're living in challenging times. Try practicing balance, letting you open to the suffering of the world without becoming overwhelmed.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: We're living challenging lives in challenging times. Try this session from Joseph to learn a balanced way to be open to the suffering of the world without becoming overwhelmed by it.
meditations.title: Balanced Compassion

meditations.description: Life is already complicated enough. Meditation doesn’t have to be, if we learn to be simple and easy.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Don't make meditation (or life) any harder than it needs to be. Get your daily dose of wisdom from a true master in today's practice from Joseph.
meditations.title: Be Simple & Easy

meditations.description: Want to wake up your loving-kindness? This practice uses the power of phrases, helping you see every experience as an old friend.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: A little kindness is a great pick-me-up in the middle of the week. Listen to today's meditation from Joseph, and increase your capacity to feel generous-of-mind by wishing people the best in life – yourself included. May you be happy!
meditations.title: Wishing People Well

meditations.description: It doesn't matter how big of a grump you are: everyone has the capacity to be friendly.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Today's meditation, from master meditation teacher Joseph Goldstein, will teach you how to build a foundational positive mindstate. May you be happy!
meditations.title: Unconditional Friendliness

meditations.description: Cooking can be a relaxing experience. Press play on this guided practice as you start preparing a meal.
meditations.title: Cooking Mindfully

meditations.description: Feel like your mind is a mess, even while you meditate? In this meditation, learn how to reduce anxiety...by not reducing anxiety.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Today's session was specifically designed by Jay to work WITH those anxious moments in order to bring relief and ease to your inner life.
meditations.title: Opening To Anxiety

meditations.description: Sharon helps you navigate the feelings and sensations of grief safely, using the breath as a neutral landing place for your attention.
meditations.title: Feeling Grief

meditations.description: In this basic breath and body meditation, JoAnna keeps it simple, moving our attention between our feet, hands, and belly to help us settle.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: It's Saturday. Keep it simple, and seize the present moment.
meditations.title: Keeping it Simple

meditations.description: Jay encourages you to stay with awareness itself, resting the mind as if resting on a beach chair: with extreme relaxation and ease.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: This is a true Sunday meditation. Relax profoundly, all while strengthening your meditation practice. Kick back & enjoy this mind expanding session.
meditations.title: Extreme Laziness

meditations.description: Oren helps us explore our relationship with pain in a balanced way, coming back to the breath or body as an neutral place for our awareness.
meditations.title: Working With Pain

meditations.description: Joseph shows how to turbo-charge your practice with three short meditations a day. Content warning: one reflects on death and mortality.
meditations.title: Turbo-Charge Your Meditation

meditations.description: Jay takes a creative approach to self-compassion, having us cultivate compassion for someone we care about as a stand-in for ourselves.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Receiving kindness helps people feel better, and perform better. Learn how to give yourself this boost with a quick meditation session from Jay.
meditations.title: Be Nice To Yourself

meditations.description: JoAnna invites you to take a break from the busyness of the world (and your mind) by resting in the here and now of breathing.
meditations.title: Taking A Break

meditations.description: Looking for a more relaxed way to transition out of bed and start the day? This short meditation from Anushka does just that.
meditations.title: Upon Waking

meditations.description: JoAnna teaches you to overcome craving by getting interested in it. Apply this meditation to any kind of craving you can imagine.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Wanting stuff is exhausting. Today's meditation can be applied to any kind of craving you can imagine: for people, for things, for experiences, you name it. At the end, you may find you're happier being right where you are.
meditations.title: Overcoming Craving

meditations.description: Life's discomforts are innumerable and unavoidable. Join JoAnna in exploring the benefits that come when we lower our resistance to them.
meditations.title: Accepting Discomfort

meditations.description: Being mindful while walking is an easy route to presence and calm. Try bringing some mindfulness to the sensations of movement.
meditations.title: Mindful While Walking

meditations.description: You can meditate anywhere during any activity. Play this guided session and discover how good it feels to be mindful any- and every-where.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: You can meditate anytime, doing anything. In today's meditation, Alexis teaches you how to be aware in any activity you've got lined up this week.
meditations.title: Wherever You Are

meditations.description: Gratitude practices are transformative. Experiment with gratitude for your own body, noticing the relaxation and ease that results.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Gratitude practices are transformative. Try today's short practice from Anushka.
meditations.title: Grateful For Your Body

meditations.description: In this guided meditation, Joseph unpacks what restless energy is all about, showing you how to go from restless to restful.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Not every meditation session is easy. In today's, Joseph unpacks what restless energy is all about and shows you how to go from restless to restful.
meditations.title: For A Restless Mind

meditations.description: This is one of Jeff's favorite meditation practices. It's his direct path to staying open and feeling more relaxed all day long.
meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: In Today's meditation, Jeff shares his personal go-to practice. The instructions are simple, but they deliver powerful results.
meditations.title: Simply Staying Open

meditations.description: Energize yourself by feeling your body waking up with this lightly guided body scan from Anushka.
meditations.title: Morning Body Scan

meditations.meditation_of_the_day_description: Today's practice on forgiveness isn’t about letting people off the hook, it's something to do for yourself. Jeff will guide you through paying attention to the places you may feel contracted or closed-off, and toward beginning to make space for a fresh, healthy, new perspective.

meditations.description: Turn your concern into connection. During uncertain times it’s important not to get flooded with worry, but to build up compassion instead.

meditations.description: Cultivate these five research-backed qualities of good parenting: presence, attunement, compassion, delight, and support.

meditations.description: Discomfort with the unknown is a natural human response. This meditation will help you relax as you practice allowing the rhythm of life to unfold.
